Apple.passage: "Apple Incorporated (styled simply Apple) is a publicly traded multinational technology company that designs, develops, and sells consumer electronics, computer software, and online services in various product lines, including personal computers, mobile phones, media players, and video game consoles. It was the first personal computer company in the world, having started in 1976. It was established by Steve Jobs and Ronald Wayne, with the help of Steve Wozniak, and incorporated a year later. Apple was formed from the company Atari Electronics. The first personal computer, the Apple II, was released in 1976, followed by the original Macintosh in 1984. Apple introduced the Macintosh in January 1984. In 1985, Apple released the first Macintosh computer. The company also started selling other electronics such as the VisiCalc spreadsheet software in 1981. After 1989, Apple introduced the iMac and also sold other electronics including the PowerMac G3, PowerBook, and the iBook. Apple designs, develops, and sells a range of personal computers, online services, media players, and mobile phones. It currently designs and sells the iPhone, Macbook, Mac Pro, and Mac mini as well as iPod products. Apple was the first U.S. company to reach a market capitalization of over US$1 trillion.

Alphabet.passage: The Google alphabet is a system of alphabetical indexing created by American linguist Edward A. Tufte in 1967 to facilitate the organization of information. Tufte created a standardized system of indexing that uses letters of the alphabet instead of numerals or other symbols. Each letter in the alphabet is assigned a numeric value, with letters assigned values ranging from 1 to 9. The Alphabet has many variations, but Tufte's system is the one most commonly used. In 1980, a related system of alphabets (called alphabetisation, which is itself defined as a system of "alphabetical indexing and numbering" but is similar to the English language alphabet in many respects) was developed by Swedish language model Lars Ekeberg. In 2000, a variation of the English alphabet was created in an experiment with the Unicode character set. It consists of letters A, B, and C, with no numerical values assigned to any of the letters. It is generally believed that the alphabet was created by Thomas Jefferson, a lawyer, educator and writer. During his tenure as the Secretary of the U.S. War Department, Jefferson, who became the author of the Declaration of Independence, used an alphabet derived from the phonetic pronunciation of letters to keep his correspondence in order. The letters in his alphabet are: 1=A, 2=B, 3=C, and so on.

A statue was later erected of a lumberjack (not to be confused with a Viking in the first two photos) holding a large board. Ljubljana: School of Arts, Sciences and Philosophy | Slovenia | Institutions of Higher Learning | National Educational System | Ljubljana Schools
The Ljubljana School of Arts, Sciences and Philosophy is a national institution of higher learning in Slovenia. It was established in 1913 and was one of the first institutions in the world to be located in a city, rather than in a castle or other large, medieval building. It is the only one of the school's institutes, and is composed of departments of arts, sciences and philosophy. The Ljubljana School of Arts, Sciences and Philosophy is the sole Slovene university, established in 1913 and was the second largest in the country by number of students, only after the University of Ljubljana. Currently it is one of the most prestigious educational institutions in the country. It consists of four faculties: Arts, Sciences, Law and Economics, as well as two departments: Medicine and Pharmacy.

Hangzhou.passage: One of Hangzhou's main attractions is the beautiful West Lake, an artificial lake in the central part of the city. The lake is surrounded by hills and mountains, with the hills on either side covered with trees and vegetation. The lake is surrounded by a park, which is a place for relaxing and walking. The lake is about 9 kilometers in circumference. The lake can be reached via the Qingyuan Station on the Hangzhou Metro Line, the Hangzhou Line, the Hangzhou Metro Line (the old city line) or Bus No. 12, 18, 32, 53 and 63. The lake has become one of Hangzhou's most well-known attractions, and is the most visited attraction in China. Many tourists also swim in the lake and play games there. There is also a zoo and a 200-meter-tall pagoda at the east side of the lake. It is said that the lake was built when the Emperor Yuhuan and his entourage were fleeing from Beijing, and that he had to drink water from the lake on the last night of his life.

Google.passage:
“Google is a technology company focused on improving the "flow of information to, and within, individuals and businesses." He has been described as "the father of data visualization" by the New York Times.

Thomas Jefferson.passage: “A large painting is hung on a wall across the room from the large window facing east on which it is painted. At this spot is the corner cupboard. The portrait, a bust with a portrait in oval frame, is inscribed "J. J. J. C. J. C. C. P. T. J. J. B. S." (which means "Jefferson J. J. B. S.").
